field.label: Title
field.hint: Enter the name of the file.
field.required: You must enter a name for this file

field.label: Description
field.hint: Enter a description for the file

field.label: Author
field.hint: Enter the author's name (Family name, Given names).

field.label: Title
field.hint: Enter the main title of the item.
field.required: You must enter a main title for this item.

field.label: Other Titles
field.hint: If the item has any alternative titles, please enter them here.

field.label: Date of Issue
field.hint: Please give the date of previous publication or public distribution. You can leave out the day and/or month if they aren't applicable.
field.required: You must enter at least the year.

field.label: Publisher
field.hint: Enter the name of the publisher of the previously issued instance of this item.

field.label: Citation
field.hint: Enter the standard citation for the previously issued instance of this item.

field.label: Series/Report No.
field.hint: Enter the series and number assigned to this item by your community.

field.label: Identifiers
field.hint: If the item has any identification numbers or codes associated with it, please enter the types and the actual numbers or codes.

field.label: Type
field.hint: Select the type of content of the item.
field.required: You must choose at least one type.

field.label: Language
field.hint: Select the language of the main content of the item. If the language does not appear in the list, please select 'Other'. If the content does not really have a language (for example, if it is a dataset or an image) please select 'N/A'.

field.label: Subject Keywords
field.hint: Enter appropriate subject keywords or phrases.

field.label: Abstract
field.hint: Enter the abstract of the item.

field.label: Sponsors
field.hint: Enter the names of any sponsors and/or funding codes in the box.

field.label: Description
field.hint: Enter any other description or comments in this box.

field.label: Resource Type
field.hint: Select the item type. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!
field.required: You must select a type for this item. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!

field.label: Check Title
field.hint: Enter the main title of the item. Use title case. Format the check name as Check Domain: Single or multiple site, anomaly or exploratory, temporal measurement. E.g., "Patient-Facts: Multiple Sites, Anomaly Detection, Measuring Across Time"
field.required: You must enter a title for this item.

field.label: Date Created
field.hint: Please give the that the check was finalized. You may leave out the day and/or month if necessary.
field.required: You must enter at least the year.

field.label: Check Creator
field.hint: Enter "PEDSnet" as the creator of the check.
field.required: You must enter "PEDSnet."

field.label: Affliated Organization
field.hint: Enter "PEDSnet Data Coordinating Center.
field.required: This field is requuired."

field.label: Check Description
field.hint: Enter a brief general description of the check. At minimum, this description should include a purpose statement of the check and some reference as to when it should be used during a study.

field.label: Raw Data Output Description
field.hint: Enter the column names of the tabular output produced by this check and any additional pertinent information about the raw output. Use complete sentences.

field.label: Visualization Output Description
field.hint: Describe the visualization produced by the check. Use complete sentences.

field.label: Check Specifications
field.hint: At minimum, add one tag to the check for each of the following categories. Use the subject tree for Data Quality Check Categorizations for assistance. Data quality characterization; analysis level; temporal evaluation; data source;anomaly or exploratory investigation; visualization output(s); quality probe; and clinical data quality assessment type.
field.required: Specification tags are required.

field.label: GitHub Link
field.hint: Insert the permanent url to the R function code for the check in a GitHub repository.

field.label: Publisher
field.hint: PEDSnet

field.label: Rights Statement
field.hint: a CC-BY Attribution 4.0 license.

field.label: Rights License
field.hint: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

field.label: Resource Type
field.hint: This item type MUST be set to "Data Quality Result".
field.required: You must select a type for this item. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!

field.label: Record Title
field.hint: Enter a title for the results using the following formula "[Check Name] Study Results: [Study Shorthand]" Examples: "Patient Facts Study Results: PRESERVE" "Source and Concept Vocabularies Study Results: CDC Epilepsy" "Cohort Attrition Study Results: JDIQ Manuscript"
field.required: You must enter a title for this item.

field.label: Date
field.hint: Enter the date this check was executed.
field.required: You must enter at least a year.

field.label: Creator
field.hint: Enter the name of the analyst or investigator who ran the code to generate this result. Do not include middle initials or credentials.
field.required: If the analyst is unknown, enter the name of the study investigator.

field.label: Affliated Organization(s)
field.hint: Enter the affiliated institution of the analyst or investigator.
field.required: An affiliation is required.

field.label: Check Description
field.hint: In 2-3 brief sentences, list the parameters of the check you used and the purpose of the check. Example: "The results of a Source and Concept Vocabularies check using the Single Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional parameters. This check investigates SNOMED mappings to ICD codes for epilepsy diagnoses. This check was run to analyze data being prepared for a grant proposal to the CDC."
field.required: This field is required.

field.label: Data Provenance
field.hint: Select the term which best describes your data source.
field.required: At least one source must be selected.

field.label: Database Version
field.hint: Input the database version used in this concept set's creation.

relation-field.label: Database Version Linkage
relation-field.hint: If PEDSnet Data Model dependent, select the record that represents the database version this concept set was created with.

field.label: Evaluation Parameters
field.hint: Select the parameters applied to your check.
field.required: Parameters must be selected.

relation-field.label: Institutional Data Sources
relation-field.hint: If PEDSnet data sources were used, select the institutions

field.label: Result Characteristics
field.hint: Select terms (as many as are applicable) to characterize your study-specific observations of the analysis.
field.required: At least one term must be selected.

field.label: Outcomes
field.hint: Select terms that characterize the outcome of the analysis.

field.label: Clinical Subjects
field.hint: Input terms that characterize the clinical domain being investigated. Reference https://meshb.nlm.nih.gov/ for terms.
field.required: Tags are required.

field.label: Results Description
field.hint: Describe your findings from the data quality analysis in full. Use this space to expand upon trends and observations in detail. Please provide some context for how these findings affected your use of the data in the study (e.g., did you modify a cohort attrition step, remove a site's data from analysis, etc.). This field is not required but highly recommended.

relation-field.label: Data Quality Check Linkage
relation-field.hint: Link to the data quality check record which corresponds to the check run to produce these results.

relation-field.label: Study Record Linkage
relation-field.hint: Link to the study record which corresponds to the investigation.

field.label: Publisher
field.hint: PEDSnet

field.label: Rights Statement
field.hint: a CC-BY Attribution 4.0 license.

field.label: Rights License
field.hint: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

field.label: Resource Type
field.hint: Concept Set must be selected for this item type.
field.required: You must select a type for this item. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!

field.label: Title
field.hint: Enter the title of the concept set. Use title case, e.g., "Anti-Diabetic Agents, Oral."
field.required: You must enter a title for this item.

field.label: Date Created
field.hint: Input the date that the concept set was first created (version 1). If the exact date is unknown, enter the first of the month.
field.required: You must enter at least the year.

relation-field.label: Creator(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the name(s) of the creator(s). (Family name, Given name)

field.label: Concept Set Evaluation
field.hint: Select the term that best describes the concept set's level of review.
field.required: A selection is required.

relation-field.label: Reviewer(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the concept set reviewer(s) name(s) if "Clinician Review" or "Review, Non-Clinician" are selected above. (Family name, Given names).

relation-field.label: Affliated Organization(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the name(s) of the institution(s) employing the individuals named in the Creator and Reviewer fields.

field.label: Intention
field.hint: Enter one sentence describing the intention of your concept set. For example, "Concept set intended to identify patients with a diagnosis of asthma to define a study cohort."
field.required: You must input at least one sentence.

field.label: Data Model
field.hint: Select the term that best describes the data model used in this concept set's creation
field.required: A selection is required.

field.label: Database Version
field.hint: Input the database version used in this concept set's creation.

relation-field.label: Database Version Linkage
relation-field.hint: If PEDSnet Data Model dependent, select the record that represents the database version this concept set was created with.

field.label: Vocabularies Incorporated in Concept Set
field.hint: Enter the medical ontologies used in the concept set.
field.required: At least one ontology must be selected.

field.label: Medication Characterization
field.hint: Select the normalized name classifications present in your concept set (medication sets only).

field.label: Concept Set Characterization
field.hint: Select the terms that best describe the concept set.

field.label: Description
field.hint: Enter a detailed description of the code set's contents and development process, then describe the purpose of the code set within a study context. Were you trying to define a cohort or investigate a study variable? Was it intended to be broad (prioritizing sensitivity) or narrow (prioritizing specificity)? What kind of topics are included in this concept set? Were there any limitations placed on this concept set during development? Is there anything potential users should know before reusing the code set?

field.label: Provenance
field.hint: Input the name of the study or query for which this concept set was created. Do not use shorthand to abbreviate the study, rather, write the full title. Note if the concept set was created for an initial study, then reused in another. Provide additional information about the specific purpose this item played in the study or studies as applicable.

relation-field.label: Provenance
relation-field.hint: Select the name of the study or query for which this concept set was created.

field.label: Clinical Subject
field.hint: Input the clinical subject terms most associated with the concept set.

field.label: Development Code
field.hint: Enter a link to a GitHub repository (or other public repository) where the development code is stored, if applicable.

field.label: Research Suitability
field.hint: Select the term that best describes the reusability of the Concept Set. Research Ready - concept set is broadly applicable; it could be reused easily as is. Needs Refinement - concept set is designed to fit a specific study purpose; it may need revision prior to reuse. Deprecated - concept set is outdated and undescribed; its reusability cannot be determined.

field.label: Rights Statement
field.hint: a CC-BY Attribution 4.0 license.

field.label: Rights License
field.hint: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

field.label: Resource Type
field.hint: Select the item type. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!
field.required: You must select a type for this item. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!

field.label: Study Name
field.hint: Enter the official study title. Use title case. Do not use shorthand. E.g., The Researching COVID to Enhance Recovery (RECOVER) Post-Acute Sequelae of SARS-CoV-2 (PASC) Electronic Health Record (EHR) Cohort Study
field.required: You must enter a title for this item.

field.label: Study Start Date
field.hint: Enter the date the study began. If an exact day is unknown, approximate to the first of the month.
field.required: You must enter at least the year.

field.label: Study End Date
field.hint: Enter the date the study ended, if applicable. If an exact day is unknown, approximate to the first of the month.

relation-field.label: Principle Investigator(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the name(s) of the PI(s) or Query Requestors (Family name, Given names).

relation-field.label: Affliated Organization(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the name(s) of the institutions employing any of the individuals listed as PIs above or associated with the study.

field.label: Funding Organization(s)
field.hint: Enter the name(s) of the organizations (according to ror.org) who funded or provided financial assitance to the study.

field.label: Study Abstract
field.hint: Enter a brief, 1-3 sentence overview of the study purpose and design.
field.required: You must provide some descriptive context for the study.

field.label: Study Description
field.hint: Enter a description of the study aims, study design, and intended cohort characteristics and the cohort formation strategy. Use Markdown headings to delineate each section.

field.label: Tags
field.hint: Enter terms that classify the Study.
field.required: At least one tag must be applied to the study.

field.label: Clinical Subjects
field.hint: Apply the clinical subject(s) most associated with the study, then input terms for up to two term hierarchy-levels higher, and others as applicable.
field.required: At least one clinical subject heading must be applied to the study.

field.label: Publications
field.hint: Enter a citation for any subsequent manuscript publication from this study. Markdown format is accepted. Please provide a linked DOI for each publication using "[]()".

relation-field.label: Related Concept Sets
relation-field.hint: Link the study to any concept sets used in the course of research, if applicable.

relation-field.label: Related Phenotypes
relation-field.hint: Link the study to any phenotypes used in the course of research, if applicable.

field.label: Publisher
field.hint: PEDSnet

field.label: Rights Statement
field.hint: a CC-BY Attribution 4.0 license.

field.label: Rights License
field.hint: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

field.label: Resource Type
field.hint: Select the item type. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!
field.required: You must select a type for this item. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!

field.label: Database or Other Entry?
field.hint: Select the most appropriate term.
field.required: Make a selection

field.label: Title
field.hint: Enter the title of the item. Use title case.
field.required: You must enter a title for this item.

field.label: Other Titles
field.hint: If the item has any alternative, additional, or sub- titles, enter them here.

field.label: Date Created
field.hint: Input the date that the item was first created (version 1). If the exact date is unknown, enter the first of the month.
field.required: You must enter at least the year.

relation-field.label: Creator(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the creator's name (Family name, Given names).
relation-field.required: You must enter at least one creator for your item.

relation-field.label: Affliated Organization(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the name(s) of the institutions employing any of the individuals listed as creators.

field.label: Abstract
field.hint: Enter a brief, 1-2 sentence introductory description of the item.

field.label: Description
field.hint: Enter a full description of the item.

field.label: Provenance
field.hint: Enter provenance information associated with the item.

field.label: Tags
field.hint: Apply tags to the item as applicable.

field.label: Development Code
field.hint: Enter a permanent link to related external resources as applicable, e.g., a GitHub Repository link.

relation-field.label: Related Studies
relation-field.hint: Select any studies related to the item or which utilized data from this database.

relation-field.label: Related Resources
relation-field.hint: Select any related resources in the collection.

field.label: Publisher
field.hint: Enter the name of the record publisher: PEDSnet.

field.label: Rights Statement
field.hint: a CC-BY Attribution 4.0 license.

relation-field.label: Contributing Institutions
relation-field.hint: Select all institutions whose data is present in the database.
relation-field.required: At least one institution must be selected.

field.label: Submission Date
field.hint: Input the date that the database data was submitted.

field.label: Data Collection Start Date
field.hint: Input the date that data collection began for this database version.

field.label: Data Collection End Date
field.hint: Input the date that data collection concluded for this database version.

relation-field.label: Related Concept Sets
relation-field.hint: Select all concept sets developed using this database.
relation-field.required: At least one institution must be selected.

relation-field.label: Related Phenotypes
relation-field.hint: Select all phenotypes developed using this database.
relation-field.required: At least one institution must be selected.

relation-field.label: Related Network DQ Checks
relation-field.hint: Select all Results from DQ Analysis run on this database.
relation-field.required: At least one institution must be selected.

field.label: Resource Type
field.hint: Computable Phenotype must be selected for this item type.
field.required: You must select a type for this item. This item type MUST match the Domain Entity type!

field.label: Title
field.hint: Input a unique title for the phenotype record. Use title case, e.g., "Anti-Diabetic Agents, Oral."
field.required: You must enter a title for this item.

field.label: Date Created
field.hint: Input the date that the phenotype was created. If the exact date is unknown, enter the nearest month.
field.required: You must enter at least a year.

relation-field.label: Creator(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the name(s) of the analyst(s) who developed this phenotype. (Family name, Given name)

relation-field.label: Affliated Organization(s)
relation-field.hint: Enter the name(s) of the institution(s) employing any individual named in the Creator field.

field.label: Phenotype Description
field.hint: Enter a few sentences describing the intention and characteristics of your phenotype.
field.required: You must input at least one sentence.

field.label: Data Model
field.hint: Select the term that best describes the data model used in this phenotype's creation
field.required: A selection is required.

field.label: Database Version
field.hint: Input the database version used in this phenotype's creation.

relation-field.label: Database Version Linkage
relation-field.hint: If PEDSnet Data Model dependent, select the record that represents the database version this concept set was created with.

field.label: Algorithm Components
field.hint: Enter the medical ontologies used in the phenotype.
field.required: At least one ontology must be selected.

field.label: Development Strategy and Evaluation
field.hint: Select all terms that apply to characterize the Phenotype.
field.required: At selection is required.

field.label: Development Population
field.hint: Select all terms that apply to characterize the patient population targeted by the phenotype.

field.label: Description of Algorithm
field.hint: Enter a description of the phenotype algorithm. Possible topics for discussion include development approach and rationale, directions for code use or implementation, and logic defined by the algorithm to define the phenotype. Markdown and html formatting is accepted in this field.
field.required: A description is required.

field.label: Provenance
field.hint: Input the name of the study this phenotype was created for, and briefly describe the role the phenotype played in the study. Do not use shorthand to abbreviate the study, rather, write the full title. If the phenotype was used in more than one study, please list and describe each usage in chronological order.
field.required: At least the name of the study must be entered.

relation-field.label: Provenance
relation-field.hint: Input the name of the study or query this phenotype was created for OR use the search tool to select the record that represents the study this concept set was created for.

field.label: Clinical Subjects
field.hint: Input terms that characterize the clinical domain being investigated. Reference https://meshb.nlm.nih.gov/ for terms.
field.required: Tags are required.

field.label: Development Code
field.hint: Enter a link to a related public repository where development code is stored (e.g., a GitHub repository), if applicable.

field.label: Quality
field.hint: Select the term that best describes the reusability of the Phenotype for research purposes. Research Ready - phenotype is broadly applicable; it could be reused easily as is. Needs Refinement - phenotype is designed to fit a specific study purpose; it may need revision prior to reuse. Deprecated - phenotype is outdated and undescribed; its reusability cannot be determined.

field.hint: a CC-BY Attribution 4.0 license.
